article.text: BEIRUT, May 25 (Reuters) - Syrian security forces opened fire at anti-government protesters on Friday, killing at least four people in different parts of the country, activists said. They said three people were killed in the northern city of Aleppo and one teenager was killed in the Damascus suburb of Irbin following Friday prayers. The British-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights also said two people were killed by shelling on Houla in Homs province. (Reporting by Mariam Karouny) (Reporting by Mariam Karouny) IMPORTANT: Your comment will not appear immediately as we vet all messages before publication.
